availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Walter Scates Dabney (Hopkinsville, Christian County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier - 1st Sgt. VA Artillery (C.S.A.))

body.p: Hopkinsville, Christian County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Albert Dabney and Elizabeth Dabney. Attended school in Christian County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned sixteen enslaved persons in Christian County in 1850. Attended the University of Virginia Law School in Charlottesville, Albermarle County, Virginia in 1858. Attorney in Hopkinsville, Christian County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Hopkinsville in 1860. Household owned fourteen enslaved persons Hopkinsville in 1860. Served in the Virginia Horse Artillery (C.S.A.) as an orderly sergeant and first sergeant from March 1, 1862 to May 19, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 2, p. 363A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 2.

Catalogue of the University of Virginia, 1857-1858Richmond: Charles W. Wynne, Printer, 1858, p. 11.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers Who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0267.
